related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @hra42 encountered a "PERMISSION_DENIED" error when using Pieces.
* This error occurred because the local database was deleted but the "com.pieces.pfd" folder was not. 
* This caused onboarding snippets and conversations to be skipped.

**Problems Identified:**

* The "com.pieces.pfd" folder is not automatically deleted when the local database is deleted.
* This can lead to errors and unexpected behavior.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Solution 1:** Manually delete the "com.pieces.pfd" folder along with the local database.
* **Solution 2:** Modify the software to automatically delete the "com.pieces.pfd" folder when the local database is deleted.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Solution 1:** Manually deleting the folder worked for @hra42.
* **Solution 2:** The issue has been reported to the development team and they are investigating a permanent fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was identified by the user, not by automatic triaging.
* The user was provided with helpful resources while waiting for a response. 
* The user was able to resolve the issue with the help of the support team.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Andrea3i is experiencing issues launching the OS toolbar in various ways (from Visual Studio, desktop app, OS app itself, etc.)
* sam-at-pieces identified two potential issues: Visual Studio plugin issue and Pieces OS version issue.
* robert-at-pieces confirmed a Visual Studio plugin issue and released a hotfix (version 3.0.1).
* Andrea3i updated both the VS extension and Pieces OS but the issue persists (toolbar not launching, OS restarting on its own).

**Problems Identified:**

* Visual Studio plugin issue causing a UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version issue causing an error when trying to host applets (OS error code not returned).
* This could be due to various reasons, including lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, account permission restrictions, or group policy restrictions.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin hotfix (version 3.0.1) released.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 to be released, including a change to how ports are chosen for webview integrations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is not fully resolved.
* A meeting is scheduled between Andrea3i and mark-at-pieces for further debugging.
* Running a utility to retrieve the OS error code is planned to determine the root cause.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights collaboration and troubleshooting efforts between the user and developers.
* The issue appears to be complex and requires further investigation.
* The outcome of the scheduled meeting and error code retrieval is crucial for determining the next steps.

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* **Problem:** Firefox instances spawned by the Pieces app are nested under the app process, causing conflict.
* The issue occurs while using the "Pieces for Developers" app.
* Restarting the machine doesn't resolve the issue.
* The problem seems specific to Windows Insider Preview builds.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Investigating the cause of the nested process behavior.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* No solution has been implemented yet.

**Additional notes:**

* The user confirmed they are not using a Windows Insider Preview build.
* The problem may be related to how the OS app spawns Firefox instances.

**Next steps:**

* Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and develop a solution.

recommendations: **Prioritize UI/UX Improvements for Pieces for Developers:** The high frequency of "Pieces for Developers UI Bugs" suggests a need to prioritize UI/UX improvements in upcoming releases. Focus on resolving glitches, loading errors, and confusing UI elements related to Copilot and Demo Chat.

**Investigate and Resolve macOS Onboarding Issues:** Address the recurring "Pieces Onboarding Issues on macOS."  This includes blank screens, demo data errors, and "Context Exceeded" errors. Ensure onboarding is smooth to avoid frustrating new users.

**Provide Clearer Communication and Workarounds for Claude LLM Context Errors:** The "Claude LLM Context Exceeded Error" is a known issue. Improve support documentation and messaging to acknowledge the issue, explain its cause, and offer potential workarounds while waiting for the fix in the next release.

**Address Pieces OS and VS Code Extension Conflicts:** Investigate and resolve the reported conflicts between Pieces OS and Firefox and Visual Studio. This includes Firefox instances getting stuck and the VS Code extension malfunctioning. Compatibility issues can be detrimental to user experience.

**Analyze and Improve Performance Bottlenecks:** Several reports mention slow performance, UI freezes, and crashes. Conduct thorough performance testing and optimization, particularly for resource-intensive operations like pasting code and handling large files.

**Review and Update Support Documentation:** Ensure support documentation and FAQs are up-to-date with information on common issues, workarounds, and troubleshooting steps. This will empower users to self-resolve problems and reduce support ticket volume.

**Gather Detailed System Information:** When users encounter errors, especially related to specific software or OS versions, ensure the support system gathers detailed system information (OS version, Pieces OS version, browser version, etc.) to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Consider a Bug Bounty Program:** To incentivize community involvement in identifying and reporting bugs, consider implementing a bug bounty program. This can help uncover and address issues more quickly.
